meanings.definition: A person or thing that pelts.
meanings.sent1: The brave knight faced the fierce pelter in battle.
meanings.sent2: The young boy was known as the fastest pelter in the village.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel turned out to be the pelter of acorns in the park.
meanings.sent4: The diligent worker bee was the pelter of pollen in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The skilled archer was a precise pelter of arrows at the target.

meanings.definition: To attack or assail with repeated blows or with missiles.
meanings.sent1: The bullies would pelter him with snowballs every winter.
meanings.sent2: The angry mob decided to pelter the castle walls with rocks.
meanings.sent3: The playful children would pelter each other with water balloons.
meanings.sent4: The hailstorm seemed to pelter the roof with icy stones.
meanings.sent5: The relentless wind would pelter the windows with sand during the storm.

meanings.sent1: The sudden pelter caught everyone off guard during the picnic.
meanings.sent2: The farmers were worried about the upcoming pelter affecting their crops.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected pelter turned the streets into rivers in no time.
meanings.sent4: The loud pelter on the roof made it hard to concentrate on reading.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds signaled the arrival of a fierce pelter in the valley.
